justification: For inclusion, children had to have normal or corrected-to-normal visual acuity (measured using a Snellen acuity chart).
Parents of all children were asked to complete the Social Communication Questionnaire (SCQ; Rutter et al., 2003).
Additionally, autistic children were assessed with the Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule (ADOS-2; Lord et al., 2012) to quantify autism symptoms.
Verbal and performance IQ scores above 70 were required, measured using the Wechsler Abbreviated Scales of Intelligence [WASI-2].

measured_by: Wechsler Individual Achievement Test (WIAT-III) Spelling subtest
justification: The standard scores from the Wechsler Individual Achievement Test (WIAT-III; Wechsler, 2017) spelling subtest were used as part of a literacy composite score.

measured_by: Test of Word Reading Efficiency (TOWRE-2) Phonemic Decoding Efficiency subtest
justification: Scores from the Test of Word Reading Efficiency (TOWRE-2) Phonemic Decoding Efficiency subtest were averaged into the literacy composite.
We administered a motion coherence task, where a proportion of dots moved coherently amidst randomly moving dots, to assess global motion processing.
construct: Global motion perception / Coherent motion sensitivity

justification: A direction integration task was used in which all dot directions were sampled from a Gaussian distribution and difficulty was manipulated via the standard deviation.
